template.description: This is a data flow that extract blobs that may or may not be compressed, decompress the compressed blobs and concatenate blobs if those are split into multiple parts.
template.name: blobs-decompression-concatenation-20210517

config.comments: Copy the attributes to the various "fragment" forms needed by the merge processor.
Concatenate blobs together ready for decompression
Merge the multirow blobs that were in multiple flow files.

Use a second stage partitioning to split the flowfiles into multiple parts so that they can be merged. Include the sequence number as part of the partitioning so that it force one row per flowfile and makes the seq number available as an attribute.

entry.value: with recentevents as ( select * from tblCEBLOB WHERE VALID_FROM_DT_TM > convert(DATETIME, '2020-08-04T12:15:00') ), mostrecent as ( select EVENT_ID, VALID_FROM_DT_TM=max(VALID_FROM_DT_TM) from recentevents GROUP BY EVENT_ID ), mostrecentcomplete as ( select * from recentevents /* this is a semi_join */ where EXISTS (select 1 from mostrecent where (recentevents.EVENT_ID = mostrecent.EVENT_ID AND recentevents.VALID_FROM_DT_TM = mostrecent.VALID_FROM_DT_TM)) ), blobpartcount as ( select EVENT_ID, COUNT(*) as BLOB_PARTS from mostrecentcomplete GROUP BY EVENT_ID ), mostrecentcompletewithblobrows as ( select mostrecentcomplete.*, blobpartcount.BLOB_PARTS from mostrecentcomplete inner join blobpartcount on (mostrecentcomplete.EVENT_ID = blobpartcount.EVENT_ID) ) select TOP(150000) * from mostrecentcompletewithblobrows ORDER BY VALID_FROM_DT_TM, EVENT_ID

config.comments:
Use SQL style queries to split the flow into records that contain an entire blob in a single row and those that don't.
Single row blobs are the most common case and can be processed in batches by the decompression tool.

The first stage partitioning will group all rows belonging to the same event together if they are in the same flowfile. It is possible for an event to be split across flowfiles, so here we separate those that are complete by comparing the row count to the blob parts attribute. Complete partitions can be processed by the concatenation tool
Break the multipart blobs into partitions based on ID and blob parts. Blob parts isn't required for partitioning, but using it creates an attribute that we can use later.
